info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 12:40AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A BAND OF SNOW PRECEDES ADDITIONAL HIGH WIND AND BURSTS OF SNOW WITH A POWERFUL ARCTIC COLD FRONT... WEATHER... * A band of snow that is ongoing from Port Huron to Brighton exits eastward and is followed quickly by a powerful arctic cold front. Both patterns present a combination of wind gusts around 50 mph and bursts of snow. The peak in snow activity coincides with passage of the front, from about 2 AM to 4 AM, while high wind lasts through the morning. * Localized snow accumulation of up to 1 inch is possible before snow showers taper off after 4 AM. IMPACTS... * Snow and blowing snow lead to hazardous driving conditions on untreated surfaces particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Very low visibility to near whiteout conditions for motorists. * Wind damage to unsecured outdoor objects. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the poor driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra space between vehicles. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
